definition: to disband/(of a partnership, group etc) to break up
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
variant of 散[san4]
meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together
farewell dinner party

sentences.english: Once the project is completed, they are off to the next hot opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 项目一旦完成，他们就散伙去抓下一个热门的机会。

sentences.english: The band decided to call it quits after the tour.
sentences.chinese: 这个乐队在此次巡游之后打算散伙。

sentences.english: He and his agent have parted company.
sentences.chinese: 他和他的代理人散伙了。

sentences.english: Friday, personal email? That equals goodbye lunch as in byebye.
sentences.chinese: 星期五，个人邮箱？直接等于散伙饭，就是拜拜。

sentences.english: The disbandment of entrepreneurial founder team is a popular phenomenon in private science & technology firms.
sentences.chinese: 创业团队散伙现象在民营科技型企业相当普遍。

sentences.english: He had a farewell dinner with his classmates to mark the end of university days.
sentences.chinese: 他和同学一起吃了顿散伙饭，以纪念大学生活的结束。

sentences.english: "Disband Dinner" takes condoms as souvenir, what's your view?
sentences.chinese: 高校散伙饭安全套做纪念，你怎么看？

sentences.english: The singer has parted company with his agent.
sentences.chinese: 那个歌手已经和他的经纪人散伙了。

sentences.english: Maybe that will be the end.
They have bolted. They've left bills all over the place.
sentences.chinese: 他们已经散伙了，把钱投到各地。

sentences.english: June 28, the whole class gathered to have the last dinner.
sentences.chinese: 六月二十八号晚上，全班同学聚集在一起吃散伙饭。

definition: (of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways
to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
to part without hard feelings (idiom)/to cut the knot as smoothly as you tied it
to part on bad terms/(of a meeting etc) to break up in discord
(coll.) to leave/to beat it
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
can't come to an agreement
(coll.) to quit one's job in disgust
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
to disagree/dissent
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
to make oneself scarce/to slip away/to take French leave
pinyin: pai1 pai1 pi4 gu5 zou3 ren2

definition: to break up/to disband
to be at loggerheads/to have a falling out
finished/to be done with sth
